info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 1:00PM EDT until March 31 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN FAIRFIELD...SOUTHWESTERN LANCASTER AND NORTHWESTERN KERSHAW COUNTIES... At 1258 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Liberty Hill, or 12 miles northwest of Lake Wateree Dam, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include... Kershaw, Heath Springs, Liberty Hill, Lake Wateree State Park, Longtown, Lake Wateree near Highway 97, Faith Christian School and McDonald Green Elementary School. This includes Interstate 77 near mile marker 42. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central South Carolina. For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. Severe thunderstorms can produce large capsizing waves and frequent lightning. If on or near Lake Wateree move away from the water and take shelter!
